Even open-ear headphones (like most of the Sennheiser HD series) are far more private than stand-alone speakers. There is another reason for their popularity, however – sound quality for price. It’s basically impossible to buy a pair of new...
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, performance, fit. Clear bass, mid and treble. Crisp and clear, your IPod to PC sound card will be pleased. I was worried the upper response was to low at 18k, but the set is so well balanced, only a very well trained ear can pick it up. These won't disappoint for the price!
There maybe better headphones out there, I've spent $350+ for top of the line ones, this set is clear. Well balanced, if I had these 3 years ago I would have said why did I spend the money, but three years says it all. Analog recordings sound the best I've ever heard, digital sounds very darn good. From Rolling Stones to The Orb. For a basic set of head phones, you can't go wrong with these!
Cable length is great, they even provided a belt clip to wrap the cord for personal MP3 players. Mow y ... our yard, clip, done.
The feel of the cushioning material is resilient. The cord is well protected for the size, I've already rolled over it with my chair more times then I care to admit. 20+ times on carpet.
Cons: Tight fit, but if you keep them on your case to stretch them for a bit not a problem. I have monkey ears, yet they fit into them. Or just break them in, after all, a good set of head phones takes some time to get used to and adjust to the user. I can wear them now near all night. Still solid and strong.
No mic for PC gamers. No line controls for volume, Would complete the overall functions on PC or on the fly with a touch. Ear sweats 1-------*---100% *cause of big ear ears*
I honestly wish I would have bought a set of these before the other many sets of of basics I did.
Sennheiser - Never has ever disappointed me. The day they do I need to learn something. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Ok Product....not as good as others
Item.Review: I really like these headphones but I must be used to open/semi-open headphones as I own the Sennheiser HD280 and 202 MKIIs now and both sound a bit muddy but I guess that's the nature of closed cans. Overall I like these headphones. The cord is very long but I wish it was a little thicker as it seems easy to break over the years. Only time will tell on that one. The pads are very good and so I give it a high rating for Comfort but fit is a bit strange. I feel the headband rides more towards the front of your head which is a strange angle compared to most other headphones I've owned and tried. The bass is there and tight, mids and highs seem a bit muffled to me but once again, this is due to them being closed headphones. Isolation is decent for the lighter weight product we have here. ... They don't do as good as the HD280s and so I would not use the 202s on a field production trying to mix audio for my recorder while in front of a loud PA but for every day outdoor productions and listening to music, they are very good at that. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, especially for the price. Good mids and highs. Pretty good lows Very comfortable even over long periods Long cord and comes with an adapter for larger jacks
Cons: For the price, I can't really complain. If I want to push it, the bass could be a little better. It would be nice if it came with a case or bag, but I still can't complain because of the price.
These headphones replaced a $200 (several years ago) pair of Bose (yeah, I know...) headphones and to be honest I like these a lot better. I use these on my laptop or plugged into my Harmon/Kardon AVR 235 and they sound great (especially though the receiver).
Some people have complained about hissing, it is more than likely from their signal source and not the headphones themselves. It i ... s also possible that they could have got a bad pair.
These aren't for pure audiophiles, but they are very, very good headphones. I would recommend these to just about anyone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones sound great for the money I spent. I got them on sale, so at full price they may have some competition. Cord is good length so that there is no tugging when you move around. Bass is loud and can be too heavy at times, but these are bass enhanced headphones. Mids and highs are fairly crisp and clear.
Cons: They squeeze your ears and make them sweaty and sore after 30-45 minutes.
Good headphones, I happy with my purchase.
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones fit very snug. They block out more external sound than the Sennheiser HD 201 headphones.
Cord is very long; 10ft. Headphones use an 1/8-inch RCA jack, and come with a ¼ inch RCA adapter jack.
They can be used to ride bicycle and or other physical activities because they block out the sound of the wind, and their snug fit prevents them from slipping on a shaved head that's perspiring. If you're looking for something to wear while working out, I'd recommend these over the 201s, but that's the only time I would.
Headphones are very light for their size. All parts have light and easy movement, but they do not slip. The cushions for the ears and head are simply fabulously comfortable.
Cons: At the time of this writing, these headphones are 34 ... .99, and in my opinion, they're over priced.
The sound is very poor for gaming. They're ok for listening to music, but for gaming, they're horrible. Not only is there too much bass, but also the bass sounds cheap and tinny. As if this weren’t bad enough, the high end is even more tinny, and the midrange sounds are no better. I came from Sennheiser’s other economical headphones the HD201, and the difference is like night and day. With the HD 202 II, the sound is much like putting a five gallon bucket over ones head, and then listening to music. It’s really that bad in my opinion.
I was a club DJ for ten years, and I have had considerable experience with headphones. I beat mixed everything, so I wore my headphones four hours each night. I am also an avid gamer for ten years now, so I’ve worn a lot of different headphones for more than twenty years now. With this, it is my opinion that you would be better served by purchasing Sennheiser’s HD 201s. They’re the same price, but the sound quality is significantly better.
If you’d like to read my review about the HD 201s, search them, and select, “Most helpful review.” My review will be at the top.
I purchased these headphones because the HD 201s were out of stock. I ruined my HD 201s letting the vacuum rug beater brush suck them up once a week for five years…
In conclusion, buy the HD 201 headphones. They are the same price and have similar features. The HD 201s sound quality is much higher, and they emulate 3d sound surround much better than the HD 202 II. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: decent sound but dreadful fit - stay away
Item.Review:
Pros: Overall, the sound quality is pretty good. A bit overdone on bass, but good sound value at the sale price.
Cons: They hurt your ears after 30 minutes (worse with glasses). I stretch them way out for 24 hours and they spring back within an hour. Just a plain awful fit - odd top band location, and plainly an awkard fit. It's so bad I have to look it I have them on backwards!! Worst ergonomics I've experienced in a long while. Buy these and you will be sorry.
It's too bad, a nice fit and I could have been very happy with these. As it is, spend your money on something that fits better, even if sound isn't quite as good!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The background noise cancelling effect enhances the clarity. Bass is bold without being overbearing. The subtleties of background sound are crisp and clear even when viewing videos. As advertised.
Cons: None, really. The cup of the earpiece is a little smallish and snug, and depending on the size of your ears, might be a little confining- no deductions.
Win 7 compatible and works well with plug and play.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice long cord with a cord caddy. Comfortable even after prolonged use. Not a bad headset for gaming.
Better than average value for the dollar.
Cons: Bass is distracting and a pinch muddy. Annoyingly over-pronounced midranges Weak replication of highs.
Sennheiser makes great headphones. This is only a good headphone that won't set you back much cash. In my opinion, if you are looking for headphone that deliver a somewhat accurate flat response, look elsewhere. If you want a set of headphones for gaming, or if you want bass for bass sake, these are not a bad choice for the buck.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: The BEST Headphones you can get under $50
Item.Review:
Pros: Strong Bass, Good Audio Performance, Long Cable, For Studio, CHEAP!
Cons: Not good at Noise Cancelling
These headphones are a great deal for indoor studio. It has really long cable so you can use them on your portable devices and also the speak, laptop and hifi devices. Great audio performance for the price. However, they are not good for travelling. Noise cancelling is not really good. They should be used in indoor studios. Very awesome product that can be used on my electronic guitar! Love them, love the price!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These live on the home entertainment center. Good sound reproduction, decent bass. Comfortable for wife and daughter, not so much for my big head. I will be ordering another pair for HEC. Excellent value and quality.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great bass response, mid's & high's are good. Lightweight. On the ear cups/cushions are soft and comfortable. Soft cushion on top of head just right. Cord length is good. Easy to adjust.
Cons: none
Not having to use preamp for pc use, simply using your standard "rock" EQ profile. Also sounds great with my higher-end surround sound system using the amp. Used playing Dead Space 2, NFSS & COD titles, more. Sound effects are great. Happy, I am and dancing! lol Thanks Newegg, for the fast processing & shipping and the special price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Bass is clear but NOT amazing!
Item.Review:
Pros: -Clear highs/mids. Sounds good on non bassy songs -Comfortable, but I don't have a watermelon sized head. It's pretty average. -Comes with a cord wrapping thing -Comes with a 6.3mm DJ audio adapter plug
Cons: -Bass is clear, but not amazing. -My $15 earbuds give a way better bass experience.
I've read the other reviews. I don't know why they are saying that the bass is so amazing. It's alright, meaning that you can clearly hear it, but you can't FEEL the bass, if you know what I mean. Sounds good, but this was not what I was expecting. If you're imagining that you could hand your headphones over to your friend to listen to an amazingly awesome bass drop in a song, then this is not going to do the trick. Great for folk/rock, Decent for electro house/hi ... p hop, and I wouldn't listen with these for dubstep. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: 1. $18 for this set of headphones was a steal and well worth the money
2. The bass in these is top notch. It feels like there is a subwoofer in your ears. Dubstep has never sounded better and the drops are unbelievable.
3. The highs are not the best highs but they are clearly way above average and when listening to classical music, I wasn't even the slightest bit disappointed.
4. As far as the comfort issue goes that I have seen other people complain about, I have had no such issues with these headphones once I got used to them. I wore them for 4 hours straight without any issue and the only reason I stopped was to go eat.
5. For $30 these headphones are well worth your investment and sound as good as headphones that cost $150 more than these. They even h ... ave an extra length in the cord for use in amps if that's how you prefer to listen to your music.
Cons: Absolutely none
Just for fun and because I was so stoked with these, I decided to have my friends listen to my headphones and guess how much the headphones cost. The average guess... $120. And let's just say that the people I asked have as much technical skill as I do and know what they're talking about. One of my friends even had the Beats headphones by Dre and we decided to compare the sound quality of the two and everyone agreed that they preferred these to the Beats HD Studio ones.
Awesome BASS!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Always wanted to pick these up, just got it as a early xmas present and i have to say they dont disappoint! pretty light and not too heavy on the head, and they do not bother my ears after long usage. (like skullcandy's, ex. mesh/g1's) the design is very nice and stylish, im not a big fan of big head phones that are wide on your head but these are exception. the cushioning on top of the head and ears are very soft and nice and the sound quality is great! for [$], sennheiser really produces the best audio (treble and bass) for that kind of money for over the head/ear head phones. really hard to beat to be honest. 4/5 stars and not 5 b/c the wire is like 6ft LONG! in some ways it is a benefit, especially if you are home and moving around on your computer.. but walking around can get if ... fy.. however it does come with a wire holder, where you can wrap the wire around this oval light plastic device to shorten it.. so thats not bad.. you can also have the option to clip that on your pants/belt/pocket if you dont want to put it in ur pocket. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Efficient Headphones with Good Bass Response
Item.Review:
Pros: Good bass response, very efficient sensitivity/SPL rating, cord take-up included, cord long enough to stretch across room, great value especially on sale
Cons: Bass response overpowers midrange and highs, just a little tight around headband and ears
The Sennheiser HD202s replace my old Sony MDR-V150s, which are very popular. These headphones blow Sony away in volume of sound. With the Sonys I had to turn the volume up almost all the way to get good, loud sound. These Sennheisers produce about the same amount of sound at half the volume. The SPL rating is 115dB, which is quite good for a $20 pair of headphones (on sale). However, the bass is quite accentuated at the expense of highs and midrange. They do take some getting used to. I guess that's probably because I'm used ... to the wimpy sound of the Sonys.
Overall, the Sennheiser HD202s are well worth what I paid. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Sennheiser HD 202 II studio- en DJ hoofdtelefoon
Item.Review:
If you have any doubts about this product because of the low price, forget about them and BUY it!! As you would expect from Sennheiser, the AUDIO QUALITY doesn't disappoint...on the contrary, I actually had to turn down the bass in the equalizer because it was too powerful!! I also tested them on many different music genres I like: house, dance, rock, classical, r&b, hip-hop, dubstep etc. You name it, these Senns can play it better than you've ever heard it. While wearing these headphones, you will be INSULATED from outside noise (and cold weather I might add, you don't need a hat or anything, so they have this extra function) so it's just you and your music, no more distractions. And your music is definitely there with you because you hear everything more clearly than ever, as ... if the artist and instruments are singing in your head :) Furthermore, I actually used them on an airplane as well without losing sound quality and without having to crank the volume to the max. And the people around you are insulated too so although the sound might be booming in your head, they don't hear anything which is also an added bonus. Don't worry about the long cable, it really isn't a problem thanks to the BELT CLIP provided (which kinda looks good because it has Sennheiser written on it) and can come in helpful, you won't have to take your headphones off when you're at your computer and want to reach for something. Also, don't worry if you wear GLASSES (like I do), you can wear these headphones at the same time even if for example you're riding your bike so no problems there. However, sometimes your ears will feel slightly uncomfortable if you use them for hours on end but that's unavoidable. Last but not least, they LOOK good, black and have a nice sleek shape. I love that they have Sennheiser written on each side, it's like the badge on a Merc: when you see it, you know it means German quality :) I mean yeah, they're bigger than EARBUDS and take up more space (this can be solved by just leaving them behind your neck, they're so lightweight you will barely feel that you have them there) but you can't get this combination of superb sound quality + isolation from any earbud (definitely not for this amount of money) and they're actually smaller than other cans-type headphones. Plus, forget about having to stick some nasty intra-aural buds in your ears that sound good (that's only because they're shoved up in your ear canal which is not healthy) but have the added annoying effect that you hear yourself amplified when you say something. I also used these Sennheisers for talking on the internet without any problems or annoyances.
In conclusion, I definitely recommend these headphones if you're looking for a pair of headphones that you can use for anything from listening to music on the go, while on a bike/bus/airplane or at your computer, playing games or chatting. Their combination of clear, powerful sound with more bass than you can handle and sound insulation can hardly be matched, especially in this price range. Plus, Bax-Shop has THE LOWEST PRICE for them I could find on the internet :) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very tight sound, decent highs, and full low end. But who am I kidding, I just finally tossed my now broken Optimus 40 headphones from Radio Shack after 20 years of use. Those get huge points for durability, but the sound of the HD 202 II has me wondering why I hung by the 40's for so long. Seriously, the 202s are a league beyond by comparison.
Cons: Wish they had the recoil style cord of the 40's, but the build quality seems pretty decent for this price range. Very slight dropout in the 6-12 kHz range, and bass heavy - which for my musical tastes is just fine.
These are absolutely an awesome deal at the $19.99 I got them for, but I would happily pay the regular price for them now that I have been able to experience them.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Price Fit Snugly Relatively comfortable but not *that* comfortable
Cons: Everything else.
These things are very close to trash.
I've gone through too many cheap headphones but these-- these things take the cake. I bought these needing a quick fix for my earbuds that died out. I figured the 202's would do well but I was almost *offended* by the $25 pricetag when I listened to sound they attempted to produce. The Sennheiser headphones are touted as bass heavy but I have to disagree. The bass output is weak and marginal at best.
The sound quality is just as poor. I've had better from headphones that come packaged with whatever electronic device.
Honestly, I would rather these take up space in a landfill than my house. I typically keep products l ... ike these "just in case" but these aren't even worth that much.
And you should note that I'm definitely *not* an audiophile. These are just that bad.
Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing Quality for a Fraction of the Cost
Item.Review:
Pros: I bought a couple of these, and I can hear EVERYTHING in the songs. All the instruments and all of the ambient sounds. The bass is just right, not overwhelming. The high-end is quite strong which is very good. Comparing this to my Plantronics DSP-600 w/ the Digital Signal Processor and Sennhesier HD280's, these HD202 II's sound is great. The provided cable winder is perfect for clearing cable clutter (all headphones should have this!!!). It comes with a 6.3mm adaptor plug to act as studio headphones. I got two of these for my home studio instead of spending hundreds of dollars for hd280's ( I have hd280's also).
Cons: The comfort is a little tight as I cannot wear these directly on the cartilage ear area, so the headphones sit partially on my ear and my cheeks (the top part of ... the jaw joints next to your ears).
Sleek design and best bang for your buck! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound, low price
Cons: Nothing
I'm not an audiophile, but I do recognize and appreciate good sound. These headphones have surprisingly good sound for the price. I mostly use them to listen to music on my computer at night via iTunes - I adjusted the iTunes equalizer to get the sound where I want it and get crisp, clear highs, good mids, and strong but tight bass. They aren't noise canceling, but they do muffle outside sound pretty well. The fit is quite tight at first, although I do have a rather large head so it might not bother people with normal to smaller heads. I owned a similar pair of Sennheisers previously (lasted me 6+ years), which were also tight at first. After a while they stretch out and are so comfortable you forget you're wearing anything. ... r>If you're looking for above-average sound and don't want to break the bank to get it, these will do the trick! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: For the price, hard to go wrong. Comfortable, long cord, good sound. Durable headband.
Cons: Wires are much too thin.
These are attached to the "family room computer" so kids can use it while someone else is watching TV. In this somewhat tough environment, the wires have come loose/broken from the headphone cups every couple months. It's simple to pop off the pad, unscrew the screws, and re-solder. However, the wires are really too thin...like ear-bud thin.
I didn't try to return...faster to get out the soldering iron.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Get more than what you pay for.
Item.Review:
Pros: These are nice headphones for the price.
There's a little kick in the bass, but nothing major. Includes a 3.5mm to 6.3mm adapter which is handy if you have instrumental equipment. The length of the cord is awesome, and why I purchased from Sennheiser over other companies. I wanted something in the sub-$20 price range so I could take them anywhere care-free. I also wanted closed headphones, and these barely leak any sound. Outside noise is dampened, but nothing too major. Both of the earpieces come off and go on easily. The top band of the headphones is soft, and the ear-foam is somewhat comfortable.
Cons: They really lack the bass that I like to hear, but I was expecting that considering their price tag.
I cannot wear them for more than 2 hou ... rs at a time or my ears are in a lot of pain. The ear-pieces are too small for my ears (medium sized). If you have medium or large ears, I would not encourage you to buy these unless you don't plan to use them for long sessions.
When the headphones are not playing music, you'll hear a static noise coming from them. This noise does not go away, but you won't be able to hear it over music playing at a low volume. I've tried multiple devices, and all have the same outcome.
These do not fold up, so make sure if you're going to take them with you that you have somewhere to put them.
If you don't have much of a budget, these are great. You must have smaller ears however, or you won't be comfortable when using these.
If you're looking for closed headphones that meet your budget, have a smaller amount of bass, and have a long cord, these are definitely for you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I'm not a professional or audiophile, but I know what sounds good to me and these sound great. I bought mine almost 10 years ago and the last couple of years the foam cover around the ear pads are finally disintegrating. I wear them for hours without fatigue, and the long cord allows me to watch television while comfortably sitting back in my recliner. The ear pockets pop on and off easily so that they can withstand some abuse, but it doesn't seem to affect performance or shelf life. I've used these on my stereo, my television and my iPhone and they work well with all of my devices.
Cons: $2 a year, cost of enjoyment could be less....just not sure how. They don't come in neon colors. They're not BlueTooth. They won't outlast me but my next pair might.
Be Careful, ... the current retail version I saw of this headset did not have the extended cord. Keep up the good work NewEgg, you're the Gold Standard. But uh... do lighten up a bit on the Guidelines, one of the reasons you're so well respected is "freedom" that silly American experiment. ;) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very good sound, long cord
Cons: They fit a little funny, the ear cushions are a bit awkward, they need to be either smaller or larger. The sides adjust a bit cheaply. My kids have popped the ear pieces off a couple times, but they pop right back on. The cord is kind of flimsy, fairly thin wire and casing.
Got these on a Daily Deal for under $20. I have several much more expensive headphones from other brands, while they fit better, feel better constructed and have heavier cords, they do not sound as good! I know Sennheiser has an excellent reputation, but have never owned any of their products. I had tempered my expectations due to the price. Overall I am very happy, I needed a budget set of headphones for the kids and these nailed it! The sound quality for the price i ... s outstanding. I will definitely be considering Senneheiser for some higher quality headphones for my own use. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones have amazing sound quality for the price and great isolation for noisy environments like riding the bus. Their bass extension rivals many phones up to $80 as the 1st phones I found that were significantly better sounding in a local shop were $80 Grados that had a little bit deeper bass. For the price, i think you'd be hard pressed to find anything better sounding. I've used them to do a lot of mixing on my PC and they have the accuracy & detail needed to get the job done and enough efficiency to get decent volume out of mp3 players. They aren't perfect though. They have headbands that squeeze your head hard even if you stretch them out on something wider then your head when you're not using them and they can make your ears sore after more than a few hours. The cables ... are a little flimsy too and my pair broke when the strap of a heavy duffle bag full of groceries I was carrying stretched the cable on the left side so it shorts out. I paid $25 for my pair and will likely buy them again after trying some more expensive and very comfortable Samsons that had really nice sound, but less efficiency or bass thump. These would make great entry level DJ phones or a nice pair of commuter cans that sound better than many others, particularly Japanese ones that are more expensive. From all of the phones I've owned and tested, you won't find anything seriously better until you start hitting the $100 mark. If you don't abuse them as I did, they're great and even if you do, they're still cheaper than phones that don't sound as good. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound and bass. Cushion ear and head pads help with getting the areas sore from long use. ** If you wear glasses, pull the arms up so they don't get pressed by the headset. This will allow you to still see but not put pressure behind your ears.
Cons: Can hear human voice still. I wear them at work to block out the people talking in my area.
Great quality for the price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser HD 202 II 3.5mm/ 6.3mm Connector Semi-Circumaural Dynamic Hi-fi Headphone
Item.Review:
Pros: sound great. comfortable too, and i have a fairly big head. i have always had a tough time with the top bar rubbing my head, these worked great. the separation and bass could not be better for the price... i bought three pair and gave two of them to my family members. i do not think for the price only 19.99 you can beat the deal
Cons: none

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They sound very good.
Cons: None.
I used to have expensive Sennheiser open headphones and did not like that I could hear ambient noises. These block out most ambient noises and sound very good. Their sound is well-balanced with good bass and clear highs.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: After reading the comments prior to purchase the headphones, I decided to continue on. The sound quality is above average for $20 headphones. Though the structural design is awkward (weird pivots), the headphones seem quite sturdy. There is also a lot of cable.
Cons: The headphones would be perfect during a blizzard. Ears may get hot because the cups are relatively small.
Previous headphones were Sound Blaster Tactic Alphas, which, for the price, shouldn't have broken a pivot after 4 months use. I'd recommend these Sennheisers over the Soundblaster.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: How have I ever used other brands?
Item.Review:
Pros: Clarity even with a lot of bass. Sound is incredible compared to my HP USB headphones. No more breaking them when I step on the cord due to how long it is!
Cons: Nothing.
I use these for listening to music only. Anything from Billy Joel to Dream Theater to Deicide sounds incredible. I don't know how I tolerated my old for so long.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They say Sennheiser on the side.
Cons: Terribly adjusted speaker balance. Way too much bass boost. Tinny, tiny highs. Mid-range? No...
I feel like I am underwater.
Terrible cheap cans, frame, and can adjustment system.
Did I mention I have a head ache from the first 2 minutes wearing these things?
I bought these with company money to use at my desk, and didn't think I could spring for a bigger price tag. I got these at a 50% mark-down. Even at the mark down price they are very disappointing. I would be livid had I paid full price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I have owned a pair of the HD 202's (first generation) for about 5 years and they are by far, the most durable headphones I've owned in this price range. The only difference between the first gen and the HD 202 II is the screw-on adaptor these have to convert to a 1/4" receiver. I've skied 5 seasons in Colorado with these and put them through some of the worst crashes and weather conditions and they still sound great.
-Affordable -Great sound quality -Durable -light weight
Cons: -The cable leading to the left phone is finally starting to loose its cover. I used a little crazy glue and some black tape and its as good as new. -The connection between the phones and the head band is plastic on plastic. So eventually they loosen up and dont hold in place super ... tight however, unless you have a tiny head they will press against your ears and stay in place just fine.
I am planning on buying this new version for the screw-in connection to 1/4 inch adaptors. I have tested Sennheiser quality time and time again and its the only company I buy from anymore. You can't go wrong at this price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: This headphones have amazing sound at all ranges. No one range overpowered another. The fit is very comfortable, though a little loose,
Cons: Extremely long cord.
I snagged this reluctantly after reading other reviews complaining about the bass sounding "cheap", but they were on sale. After receiving, it took me some time notice the "cheap bass", but it's not the lack of quality. These headphones don't have the deepest, most powerful bass I've heard-- As stated before, these have amazing sound quality at all levels. The mid level bass is amazing, but the deep bass is somewhat weak, but I think that is part of the design because more often than not, the deep sounding bass overpowers mid and high range sounds. With these headphones, I can hear all sounds, without one over ... powering the other in all genres of music, including techno, hip-hop, metal, folk, and more. If you primarily listen to techno, hip-hop/rap, and are a bass junkie, you may want to look elsewhere. For the rest of us, the bass is more than adequate, and is very well balanced. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: they're efficient (they play loudly), good for games on cheap sound cards, and they have an 8' cable
Cons: I can only describe the sound quality of these headphones as grotesque for music and concert DVD videos. I expected much more from a fifty dollar retail item, and they squeeze my average-size head so tightly that they become uncomfortable in about 15 minutes. I tried some extreme equalizer settings to minimize bass response, but it didn't help much, as the drivers are just too cheap and distortion seems way too high. I seriously doubt that 0.5% THD spec. More like 10% probably, especially in the bass frequencies.
Yes, I'm an old hippie from the 70's who is serious about sound quality, and Sennheiser used to be a respected German company, which is now marketing ... cheap, low quality, Chinese junk. Beware, audiophiles. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Really a good choice for overall, general music listening - plus more, of course - in my humble opinion. A lot of the reviews touted the bass performance, but for a non-DJ like myself, I had to turn the bass settings on my equalizer down a tad! Great overall performance on these headphones - a nice long cord, and comfortable to wear as well. I've been using Sennheiser headphones for personal audio use since a teenager in the 1970's, these are no exception to the overall 30+ year experience of owning a pair! My 16,000+ song MP3 collection grew new roots, branches and leaves in the last week using these.
Cons: None that come to mind over the last week of use.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Bass response is great. Overall sound is better than average, especially for a $22 pair of headphones. Construction is average.
Cons: None
Newegg is one of the best companies I've ever dealt with, for approx 8 years for me.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Great sounding cans for less than a third part of the usual cost of professional studio headphones. Very comfortable and nice design too. Ideal for ipod and music listening.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are comfortable and produce good sound. I like the padding on the ears and headband. The plastic does feel a little cheap, but that's to be expected for low-cost headphones! The headband itself does not adjust for size, but the earpieces slide up/down to adjust for size and that works well. My head is small, so I'm always using the smallest size setting on headphones and the smallest setting on this pair works just fine for me!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great bass - If you don't agree with me, set the equalizer of what you're playing - slide the 125 Hz up about 1/3 of the way to the top (from the middle), 62 Hz about halfway, and 31 Hz about 2/3 of the way (or something like this if your sliders are different, mine are on Realtek audio manager). Leave every other frequency as it is.
Fit well. They might not cover my ears all the way, but they aren't too tight or too loose. I wore these on a plane for 3 hours straight and wasn't complaining at the end.
Cons: They don't cover your ears all the way. For me, they go mostly around my ear, but I can tell my earlobe is hanging out. Makes it feel like they aren't on all the way.
If you want them to sound AMAZING, you can push them against your head, and the music sounds ... MUCH fuller. Shouldn't have to do this.
These aren't magical or anything, but for $22, they're as perfect as they come.
Construction? Most people complain about it. However, I took these on vacation and they were sticking out of my suitcase, and the cab driver PULLED ON THEM TO TRY TO LIFE THE SUITCASE before realizing it wasn't a handle. He bent them really far, but they didn't snap or anything.
Padding - this does seem like the type of stuff that starts to wear away almost immediately. Hasn't happened to me yet, but I've only had these about a month. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: This thing is better than over-the-ear headphones at it's original price point. Great bass, accurate mid-range and highs. Very good at ambient noise blocking. Comfortable for me as I can wear them all day long.
Cons: None.
I bought a pair for my wife because she had just broken her latest pair of Koss phones. I was so impressed that I had to get my own pair. At this price they're a steal. I like my tunes, but not willing to pay $80 to $200. So I had spent around $60 and various pairs including some Koss and Sony, and I can say that these not only compare, but blow them away with the sound production and bass response.
At this price, buy them. You will not be disappointed and you're wallet will love you.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great deal for the price, the sound is awesome, nice bass overall it is a great headphone compared to the price.
Cons: After a year of using it the wire that connects to the plastic on the right earpiece snapped. It could be due to normal wear and tear but I do feel that the insulation of the wire is a little bit thin. After 2~3 hours of wearing it it causes some discomfort on the ears.
I have to buy a new headphone now. :- /

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I was pleased with how crisp the sound was and how good the base was for the 30 dollar price range that I paid for mine. It was also very light and had a long cord which was also good.
Cons: The headphones feel like they were very cheaply made. I also am not a big fan of the method for which you adjust these headphones. I have put some wear and tear on my pair, and sometimes when I wear the headphones the bracket were you adjust it at does not hold and they slide down. It is irritating because although the headphones still sound fine after like 6 months of use, the design and materials of the headphones have ruined my pair. I would suggest going with a different design of headphones than these, but I am pleased with the quality of sound that sennheiser provides.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Use the headphones for what they are made for and you won't be disappointed. It seems like most of the low reviews are from people who didn't recognize what they were buying...
These are $25, BASS HEAVY headphones - they are NOT made for gaming, and they are NOT made for extreme audiophiles.
If you want inexpensive headphones that put out solid bass and a high quality overall sound, then buy these. I listen to a lot of dubstep and hip hop music as well as several podcasts while I work every day, and these things are perfect for that.
They're comfortable for anyone with a reasonably sized head, block outside noise surprisingly well, and produce excellent sound quality for the price you pay. The bass is pretty tight for the most part, never gets distorted, and is ... not overdone in my opinion. They sound better than the incredibly overpriced Beats by Dre and will last you longer.
Cons: The cord is super long but it comes with a nice device to wrap it around, so it's really not a big deal. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Decent Sound, that 99 cent store plastic toy feel.
Item.Review:
Pros: Decent sound, I can crank up the volume way up and these headphones won't crackle like most sets do. I'm no audiophile so I won't be able to tell you about those mids, highs, muddies, or whatever verbiage the audiophile crowd uses these days. But they play sound and don't suck at it. Long cord too so you can hook these up to a decent stereo system (or portable amp, etc.) and they are very light so wearing them around to school, work, etc. won't pose much of a problem.
Cons: All the pro's above however are rendered useless buy two rather huge, in my opinion, flaws on these headphones: cheap flimsy headband (I've felt better construction from the plastic handles of 99 cent plastic buckets) and one very thin, extremely thin cord that feels as though it is going to snap if you so ... much as look it the wrong way. The long cord itself is extremely thin and I won't be surprised if the headphones get a short later on because they got twisted in some random odd way or some random moon cycle. Looking at the product pictures listed here on newegg and pretty much anywhere else (not to mention the price), you would expect some decent construction on them but nope, just cheap, made in China knock-off quality. Just to physically feel what these headphone are like: go to a MC'ds, BK, Carl's Jr etc, buy a large plastic Soda cup, and feel the plastic, good? Congrats, you are holding something built much sturdier than these Sennheiser headphones.
Horribly disappointed and it is only my pure luck that I got these on special with the newegg coupon that lowered them to around 20 dollars. However, they usually retail for around $45-50 and in my opinion, are horribly overpriced junk. Going around the net, reviews here and on that other online retailer that shall not be named, you'd think these headphones were up there with the second coming of . If I could return them I would but I'm not fond of paying restocking fees and at the very least, these headphones will later end up as a decent testing bed for my new soldering kit and my DIY sensibilities. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Really long cord for those who want it. It has awesome isolation, where I can't hear anything that a person is saying to me when the music is playing. I like the cushion. Honestly, I tried Dr. Dre that's my friend's and yes it's worse than Dr. Dre, but not $130 worse to me.
Cons: Doesn't cover all of my ear. Bass isn't that big. Long cord. I wouldn't carry this around because there's so much cord.
Great product for the price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: inexpensive, sound quality is good. Looks good too. The cord is nice and long, and I can sit back on my bed and watch movies,etc.
Cons: The ear muffs are kinda uncomfortable. In the beginning they will really turn your ears hot, but you will get used to it. I think they ear cushions are made for people with small ears (mine are pretty average size). If you wear them even a bit tilted on your head, they will start hurting your ears.
Bottom line - If you are not an acoustic freak, Buy these. For $29, they are really WORTH IT. Don't spend money on Bose's expensive headphones; these are the best bang-for-the-bucks

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sound quality, extremely long cord length which is nice.
Cons: THEY HURT. Squeezes my ears so bad, it becomes quite uncomfortable after 15 minutes and just plain painful after an hour.
The HD 201 headphones are the best ones I've ever owned, so I thought I'd try the HD 202. Huge mistake, the design is very different and I simply cannot even use these anymore.
Buy the HD 201 headphones, not these.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Rich sound, snug fit. The cord unplugs from each ear piece so if you accidentally pull the cord it won't break the headphones.
Cons: They fit tight at first. They stretch out eventually and are very comfortable after that. The cord is also unusually long. It comes with a belt-clip to wrap the cord around, of all things.
I would recommend these if you don't mind the long cord.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great sound at a great price
Item.Review: I'm no audiophile, but I do recognize good headphones from bad. This pair lives up to the brand name in that its sound output is nice and even. They are quite comfortable compared to others in their price class as well. The only real complaint I have is the length of the cord since I actually use these on the go. However, these were built for home audio so that shouldn't factor. It's easy enough to wrap the cord up a bit for on the go use. I'd definitely recommend these to anyone in the market for sound quality, decent noise cancellation and comfort.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality is great compared to other headphones in the same price point. High's are ok, but they seem more faint than that of the mid and low range. Personally, the long cord is a pro, I often use my headphones attached to devices (pc's, amps, audio interfaces, ect.). So, I won't nessessarily be using my DAC, or Interface with these headphones, but the cord was something I am just use to.
Cons: The sound is good when comparing to some headphones in the same range, but when compared to higher products not so much. Compared to a set I use often (280 pro), these are definitely more mushy on the high and mid range. I use highend audio technica headphones as well, and there isn't a comparison, BUT I did buy them expecting anything different.
Bought these as just an extra ... set for when people come over and I am using mine on the interface or listening to music, they can use these. They are worth $30, but they aren't for audio buffs. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: This headphone have very good bass. I use it for film to monitor my audio. My biggest pet pieves with it is that it's so cumbersome and it's cord are way too long

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The quality is pretty good for the price. The bass is pretty good. Some reviews said the cord was thin. I'd say its average for these types of headphones although higher end ones would have a thicker cord.
Cons: There could be just a little more room for the ears and its just a little snug on my head. I could see them getting a little uncomfortable if you wear them for too long which is why I only gave it 4 eggs.
Even knowing that they are a little snug I still would have bought them mostly because its hard to get good headphones for the price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I bought these hoping to have an upgraded replacement for my worn out Sony Mdr v150, which are my favorite sub $20 headphones ever. My higher end sennheiser and beyer headphones (I hate calling them cans) each have a suited role, one has lesser bass and better mid, the bd have strong range around. My sony had great bass with sacrifice of high. So, these were bought for a bass-inclined rough and tough backpack pair. They work well for that purpose. No muddiness, trebles aren't strong, but these are dj headphones. They don't really block out much noise based on design.
The cord is long enough for tower usage.
Cons: Thin cord, feels flimsier than other headphone cords, not sure how many accidental tugs it can take.
Worth $20. Not worth $50, you can find b ... etter midrange and high end range for that money
I don't think they are better than the (discontinued) Mdr v150, but if you need a low cost bass pair, these work well for what they are expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Can plug right into ipod or computer, comes with an adapter for musicians/hi res audio. Fits snugly to ear and isn't uncomfortable at all except when I have my earrings in, which is fine. Nice bass and sound quality!
Cons: None, will buy another pair to work out with.
On sale at 24.99, great buy.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: These were on sale for $20 when I purchased them.
> sound quality: Great, I haven't heard any static or anything while using these.
> Sound range: Also great for the price. There is a bias towards the lows, but unless you're listening to intricate music (ie classical) the range is just fine.
> Design: a lot of headphones look really tacky or pretentious when people use them in public; since I bought these for portable use, I have to say that I'm pleased with the design. I don't feel like I just walked out of a steampunk comic when I roam around wearing them.
Cons: I hate having to slash an egg from such a great product, but there are two very critical things to be aware of before you make your final decision.
> Tightness: After extensi ... ve research, I am a bit worried at how underplayed this is on the Newegg reviews. There are mixed opinions on this, but the general consensus -- from many other reviews, and myself personally -- is that they are uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time. This seems to be somewhat counter-intuitive to the whole "DJ" gimmick, and even now, after an hour and a half, my ears are pretty sore. I am truly envious of the user who wrote: "But just move the phones a little bit and I am good for another hour"; this isn't always true.
>Cord length: this isn't really a con, and certainly not why I dropped an egg, but if you want to use these for portable devices, the cord is really long. It comes with a cord-wrapper, but the slots at each end seem like they could end up being a damaging factor over time.
Overall, I'm pleased with my purchase. For the price, they're worth taking the leap of faith. Just be warned, they may be too tight for comfort. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: great sound quality both with treble and bass. definitely a fan of the dual input as well. highly recommend
Cons: ...if anything, the cord is a little long. but i guess it makes sense since they are DJ styled.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: These headphones are clear and seem to reproduce sound very well. Good low and high ranges. The sound does not seem mottled whether it be games or music or talk radio. The comfort is excellent. They do not cause my ears to sweat nor do they fatigue me after hours of wearing them while playing Skyrim late at night.
Cons: The only con is they are dual cord.
I paid $15 and I'm extremely pleased. I think I would have still been pleased if the purchase was $30 as I compare them to a set of Koss I had at that same price.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I'm very impressed with the Sennheiser Headphones. I've had this product for quite sometime. I use them for home and professional podcasting and commercial audio. I use this product daily. Usually, I'm extremely tough on headphones. They have passed my test for sure.
Cons: Just a noteworthy observation: The cord near the ear pieces can easily be tangled causing stress on the L - R right wire. Though no issues yet. Also Some devices have a different frequency response which can degrade sound quality. For example, older Ipods, some portable mp3 players, But most of the newer stuff sounds perfect. Including mobile phones.
I recommend this product to others for the low end price, and decent product.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The sound quality is amazing, the headphones fit snug to my head and are comfortable. Also comes with a 3.5 to 1/4 adapter of decent quality.
Cons: They make your ears sweaty if worn too long.
The cord is a bit long, but they come with a part to wind the cord around and clip it. It has a clip on the back to hold it to your clothes.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Lots of bass Comfortable Keep your ears warm :) Great price
Cons: They weren't ideal for what i wanted them for. I wanted to cheap out on over-the-ear producer headphones(bad idea.)
Will be buying better headphones one day when i feel like coughing up the dough.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I have absolutely no complaints on this set of headphones. I operate a large sound board for our church services and needed something to hear what was actually going to the house. These are perfect. Our music includes live groups, singles, and CDs. The quality is quite high and has to be properly balanced to sound right. These totally fit the ticket. I could have saved one dollar by buying from another source but decided on the reliability of B&H.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I was first skeptical about the bulkiness of this toy -- all plastic cover. But, don't let the plastic design fool you! Long story short I had great Sony headphones that fell the day I most needed them. So I took a quick trip to B&H for new ones, but of course I did some research and this one came up! Sounds is great for someone who doesn't have the money to buy expensive gear! I am actually on the bus as I am writing these comments, and listening to some music with headphones! It's only been 3 weeks so I can't really talk too much about durability! So far so good :-)

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The audio is amazing, the bass is full and they aren't flimsy or cheap.
Cons: To me, I just don't like the independent sliding earphones but I can learn to love it.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Light and classy looking. No old fashioned curly cord.
Cons: Does not block ambient sound very well. Price was nice but I only get 1/3 of it back on returning the item - after $10 shipping and $3 restock fee - adds up to a $20 loss. :-(
Don't buy this if you're looking for a headset that covers your ears - unless you have ears of a 2 year old :-)

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Really long cord, great sound and bass response, comfortable after wearing them for 8 hours straight.
Cons: Zilch.
Bought these on sale for $20 and they are honestly the best headphones I've ever owned. Don't waste your money on the more expensive ones.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The sound quality is not as good as I had hoped for a Sennheiser product. I am using these for audio editing and I don't think they are the right model for that. I have a pair of Panasonic's that were about the same price but the sound quality is much richer.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Own two pairs of these, one at home and other for listening to music at work. Great frequency response, and are very good for gaming, as long as you have a decent sound card as well.
Cons: None.
Only ever had to replace one set of these, due to about 4 years of constant heavy use and stepping on them accidentally a few times over the years. (Original HD 202 model)
Am tempted to buy another pair to keep in storage in case they ever stop making these. At this price, and w/free shipping, why not!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price!
Cons: Delicate, easy to break these if your not careful.
Invest in a nicer pair if you have the money to spend.
Otherwise these are just what you need if it fits your budget.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: bought it for 22$. for this price it's really good deal. sound quality is good. for this price i feel sound is superb.
Cons: I feel the headphones are little small. if you have a big head then you may feel little uncomfortable. any way I dont have this problem.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: it's brand name, great sound for music in my opinion. Great long cord enables me to move around freely around my room. Works great with my amplifier, living in a small apartment I needed something so I wouldn't bother my neighbors!
Cons: Horrible for gaming, that's basically 2 broken eggs alone. They're a bit tight and if you are going to wear them for a couple of hours at a time; it may bother your ears. It's not that bad, just need some getting used to it. The item looks a bit cheap, I was expecting better quality structurally, but that's the least of my concerns.
Not for Gaming! you've been warned! I play Modern Warfare 2 and in comparison with my standard sony earphones I can't hear footsteps very well, or other highs that help me detect enemies aurally. They are mu ... ffled by lows and background sound effects. I do like them though. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Pretty affordable. Cord is long, and comes with a cool little cord wrap so the cord isn't in the way everywhere.
Cons: You get what you pay for, these don't sound all that great. Not as much bass as I was expecting seeing how they're advertised. Just a pretty flat overall sound.
They're not too comfortable, kinda heavy...
If you don't have an audio ear they'll be fine, but if you're at all picky about sound you won't be satisfied with these.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great look, Long cord, brand name
Cons: too tight, very small ear openings
The sound is OK, nothing special. I am a bass lover and again nothing special. The worst thing is the tension of the plastic. It is too tight. I need to leave them on something to stretch otherwise getting headache in 20 minutes. The are fine for people with or without glasses.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I got these on sale for $18, they are worth every penny. Originally $30. I dont see that price in these.
Cons: could be better quality but for the price they are alright.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I work in the oilfield and sometimes I work the graveyard shift. I use these headphone to sleep during the day. I plug them into my phone so I still have an alarm to wake up for my next shift. They also make for great sound deadeners for when I get home with 4 kids running around the house. Also they sound just like a surround sound system when I get to turn them up.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: The sound is very good.
Cons: Didn't last very long.
I am revising my previous 5-star review with this 1-star review. I bought these less than 6-months ago and they are now in the garbage. The left ear in mine began cracking and wouldn't work unless you held the cord a certain way with your fingers. It got worse. I removed the padding and looked at the wires on the inside. I couldn't see any frays, nothing that could have resulted in these doing what they did. Do not recommend unless you get a more expensive pair. You do in fact get what you pay for.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: For the price it is a great deal! can not go wrong with it!
Cons: the headrest seems like it is off shaped but not a big deal
overall happy with my purchase!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great sounds, bass, and treb..very clear. For $17...it was the best purchased I've done in years... I should of purchased multiples as gifts... :(
Cons: none

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: I have used these for a while now and they do not hurt my ears. These are an excellent value. I would highly recommend them.
Cons: None so far. I think the people that said they hurt their ears have too sensitive ears. They are really comfortable to me.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: None
Cons: Sound is horrible. There is a constant low hissing in the background and in general they sound as empty as the weakest ear buds I have heard. A few people have mentioned how small the headphones are, but I was still amazed. These are tiny and incredibly uncomfortable. They started to give me a headache within minutes...the horrible sound probably didn't help, but I have never worn headphones that were remotely as uncomfortable as these.
I can't believe there are so many high ratings for these headphones, they are absolute garbage. I immediately ordered a cheaper pair of Koss which I know to be comfortable and have far superior sound. Unless I was sent a pair of gag headphones instead of the real product, I can only assume that anyone who claims these ar ... e decent has never heard or worn anything other than the worst headphones in existence. Do not be fooled by the reviews, these HD 202 II headphones aren't worth 99 cents, and Sennheiser should be ashamed to charge well over $20-30 for this joke of a product. I used to love Sennheiser, but they have now lost my business forever. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Fit Too Tight, Ear Cup Too Small
Item.Review:
Pros: Free shipping.
Cons: Fit too tight, made of cheap plastic, ear cups too small for over-ear, too big for on-ear, poor fit, headband is cheap plastic. I have purchased several Sennheiser headphones over many years, although the last pair I purchased was almost 10 years ago. My how the mighty have fallen as these headphones are just cheap plastic. The Sennheiser of old would've made the headband with metal and ear cups that actually fit over the ears of a human being. These things squeeze your head uncomfortably and cause my ears to feel hot and sweaty after just a few minutes.
I got these for $19.99 and that was still more than they were worth. I honestly wouldn't take these if you gave them to me as comfort is priority for me with headphones. Contacting Newegg abou ... t an open-box return. They're shipped in one of those infamous, ultra-sealed plastic hanger boxes you have to cut with scissors just to get into so I'm expecting problems with the return. I hope I'm wrong because I want my money back on this junk. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great all around freq. response. Bought two sets, might go ahead and buy some more for other family members.
Cons: One thing I remember reading is that some people complained about ears not fitting right. I have big ears, and they fit pretty good, tips of ears get a little sore after about an hour of wearing. But just move the phones a little bit and I am good for another hour.
I would buy these, they are as good as or better than a lot of the more expensive ones out there.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality is alright, cord length is great for pc users
Cons: High ends are tinny / hollow, ear covers were made for freaking leprechauns. I've never thought of my ears as abnormally large, but seeing as how I'm like the only one complaining of how these things make my ears hurt after a mere 2 hours makes me think otherwise.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Cheap, good sound, and comfortable.
Cons: They make you addicted to music.
I have been using my horrible laptop speakers for years so I bought headphones. I plugged them and tested them with some Daft Punk and the quality just blew my mind. Newegg had the best shipping speed on these and they arrived in perfect condition.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very comfortable, replaces my 10 year old Sony head phones that I dearly loved. The new ones are much lighter and have the same excellent sound qualities.
Cons: For me the cord is a bit too long.
Would buy again, and do recommend them to others.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: - got these on sale for less than $20 including shipping - fairly comfortable (for me) even while wearing glasses
Cons: - don't care much for the way these add permanent bass boost... to everything - high end sounds tinny, mid-range is hollow or non-existent
Many headphones can really be lacking on the low end, but either I've gotten used to that or the 'dynamic bass boost' that these offer is just not to my liking. Speech, music, gaming, everything through these has 'boom' but not would I call 'bass' ... low-end boost is overdone at the expense of mid and high-range.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight, tight bass, great mid and high range. Absolutely worth the $20 I paid on sale. It's not on sale anymore yet I bought 2 more for my kids.
Cons: Doesn't make coffee!
None so far.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very Comfortable, Lengthy Cord, Supurb Sounding Quality. Works with PC, TV and even my Walkma (Remember Walkmans?)
Cons: NONE
Only thing I would consider changing, I might want a Volume Control on the Cord, Other than that ... "If it Aint Broke...Do'nt Fix it" NO Complaints,

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Comfortable and easily adjustable. The Cord length is great and the clip allows for simple adjustments. I use this when watching some early morning live football matches when I don't want to wake anyone up with the loud noise from the TV. The sound quality is great as well! As always, BHphotovideo as the best price. A steal of a deal for a quality product.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: reasonably priced
Cons: earcup is too small to cover the whole ear, too big to fit in the tunnel, not vented, feels hot after wearing it for a while.
invested on a good headphone

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They used to sound really great
Cons: After very minimal use, the speakers sound blown and are very fuzzy sounding. I don't listen to things loudly at all. Usually everything I listen to has the volume below 50% as well as the computer volume being set to about 40%.
I figured they would go out someday, but I didn't think that day would be so soon.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice ear coverage (not quite over-ear, not quite on-ear, somewhere in the middle for me). Sound dampening, to some extent. Excellent sound quality! Long cable makes placement very easy.
Cons: Ears can get warm after an hour or so. Not really a big deal, just adjust them or take them off for a few minutes.
After owning nothing but cheap headsets for years, this is an amazing difference. If you can catch these on sale, snatch them up!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Fairly large range of high. Nothing sounds muffled. Fairly inexpensive.
Cons: Bass isn't so bassy. Can't really use stock EQ settings? Was tight at first.
These probably shouldn't be advertised as having powerful bass. They are pretty good, but not like root beer float good. For whatever reason I couldn't use the stock EQ settings with my iPod. Whenever I changed the EQ the loudness dropped quite a bit and everything got kinda muffled. And like with the previous generation, these were very tight at first. I know I have a big head, but still, it was very tight. After letting them stretch put overnight on a stack of books they felt a lot better.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Having spent over $10,000 from newegg over the years a deal like this is troublesome. The $29.95 price is more expensive than all the competitors? The reviews on the quality of this product are great by the way.
Cons: I have noticed the shellshockers quite often are more expensive than the regular price elsewhere? Why is that?
I still love Newegg, just not sure why they do something like this? And on another note. Why are items that have 1 star with tons of reviews listed as shellshockers. Why feature a junk item? Or if a company does not pay it's rebates, why is it still sold? You have the power to stop this by not featuring or selling bad products? Keep your reputation clean. (steps off soap box)

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Extremely loud, no problems hearing anything! Great bottom end, I like them better than in ear headphones.
Cons: Wish they would block outside noise a little better and could be a little better fitting so they don't fall off when I'm headbanging!

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: great price, above average sound reproduction
Item.Review:
Pros: price, lightweight
Cons: comfort
i find these headphones to have great sound reproduction for listening to my mp3, but very uncomfortable after a hours listening. They are advertised as over the ear but for me they are more like on the ear and I don't have large ears.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: these head phones are awesome ..for the price
great sound, bass is very good , have to crank the 5.1 to 'feel' the music better (metal)
Cons: they don't rattle the windows like the stereo
I flipped the headband so it's under my chin to make them more comfortable/easier to put on take off

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Deep Base, Clear mids, long cord
Cons: Somewhat distorted at hi volumes
Does not have the swivel earpeices and the cups are not removable for replacement or cleaning but overall a very good sounding set for the price compaired to beats (friend has a pair) sound is very simular quality wise the area where beats and other hi-end sets soar is the comfort of the set

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality is really up there , its very comfortable . Its the best at its price too even compared with other higher priced headphones . I actually want to say thanks for these lol
Highly recommend them!
Cons: None
Cable is long, which is perfect for what i'll be utilizing them for. it shouldn't be a problem for others, they send a 'wrap stay'(is what i think its called ) to manage the cables length .

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Looked at these on [@]and decided to buy them here and save a few bucks.The shipment came right away and when they said it would.As for the headphones; they are great.Awesome sound, the cord is really long and for my purposes there isn't a better set for the money.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: They worked great while they lasted - but only for six months. Perhaps there's a manufacturer's warranty but seems like a lot of trouble!
Cons: Did not last - died.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: One side sounds pretty good. Its Sennheiser after all.
Cons: Internal problem, only one side works.
It was DOA, but it was also a gift. The person didn't tell me it wasn't working till months later, because they didn't want me to feel embarrassed. Now its out of warranty and I look like I bought a super cheap dollar store gift.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: - Nice bass - Decent mid/highs - Affordable - Noise cancellation
Cons: - Long cord (but the new cord wrapper makes up for this)
Great set of entry level head phones that shouldn't be passed up by anyone! Great for every day listening or for gaming and movies.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I´ve been using this headphones for 1 year, bought it as a replacement of HD 201. I must say it´s a huge difference between those 2 models. HD 202 have so much more power, but still very clear sound...After using HD201, i found some new sounds in songs i usually listen, the sound became more detailed. Talking about which genre it suits best i would say - rock, alternative, metall and all these energetic genres. For classics i would recommend to find something else.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones are really useful for me. I DJ and edit music and without these headphones I would not know how to edit different songs and beats together to make a sound that hopefully hundreds will listen to.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: - Long cable - Acceptable sound quality with decent bass - Good stereo (some headsets don't do too well in stereo at this price) - Comfortable cups - Good minimal sound leak for the price
Cons: - Long cable - Sound quality could be better

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything is great about these head phones! I own them since about 1year and half and WOW !
Cons: THey didnt do my homeworks !
What are you waiting for??

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: * Sound & comfort more than adequate for $30 * Easy to adjust to fit your head but not so easy to accidentally bump & knock them out of whack * Fit well over the ears & attenuates ambient noise rather well * Good bass response but doesn't overwhelm the mids & highs
Cons: * I'm not so sure how long the "leatherette" (read: synthetic) ear pads will last, however, you can supposedly purchase replacements. * There is no width adjustment to account for really wide or narrow heads.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: name brand, cheap
Cons: not comfortable compared to other Headphone I own from Sennheiser
I bought this to use it in my office. It is very uncomfortable, the earcups sit on the ears (because they are too small), not around them, feels tight and squeezed. The back is not vented so the ears feel hot after a while. I own two other sennheiser headphones priced from 100 to 200, they are much much better. My advise to perspect buyer is to invest it on a good headphone. To be fair to the mfg, it is cheaply priced, so my expectation is probably too high.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, bass and treble, price
Cons: the plastics feel like they were previously used to make ninja turtles, like they will shatter and break apart at a moments notice
for $35 theses are great headphones, I wouldn't pay more for them though

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy setup. Very intuitive to use and to quickly print photographs which my wife struggled greatly with on our previous printer. Networking/sharing is a piece of cake. Finally, I have solved the printer issues in our house.

Item.Item: Sennheiser HD 202 II - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
